subject: Music
title: The Alzheimer's Effect
description: A quick win: understand The Alzheimer's Effect.

hook.text: Patients who can't remember their own name still sing every word of their favorite song.

buildup.text: Alzheimer's destroys recent memory first â€” but musical memory sits in a different region.

discovery.text: The supplementary motor area stores musical memory and is among the last regions damaged.

twist.text: Playing familiar music can temporarily restore awareness and emotional responsiveness.

climax.text: A patient might not know where they are â€” but a familiar melody brings them home.

punchline.text: When memory fades, music is the last thing to leave.

quiz.question: Why can Alzheimer's patients still remember songs?
options: Musical memory is stored in a region that's damaged last
